intro: Brachyactis angustus, commonly known as the narrowleaf brachyactis, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Brachyactis angustus is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it has adapted to withstand drought conditions.
